entry.title: If It Saves You
entry.summary:
Author: jjstilinski

Rating: Not RatedLanguage: EnglishWords: 11,302Chapters: 1/1Kudos: 0

Summary: Buck and Eddie are barely speaking to each other. Eddie pushes Buck away, because admitting to his own feelings is too scary. Buck blames himself because that's what he does best. But when an arson case puts both their lives in danger, they grow closer than ever.- - OR; Eddie needs an NDE to confess his feelings for Buck.

entry.title: Second Chances
entry.summary:
Author: starylighting

Rating: MatureLanguage: EnglishWords: 618,077Chapters: 66/?Kudos: 85

Summary: Bobby and Athena are just two people trying to put their lives back together while figuring out how to co-parent. What starts as a complicated plan to foster kids in need slowly turns into something much deeper. Through the ups and downs of heartbreak, healing, and raising children who‚Äôve been through so much, they find strength in each other. Over time, their partnership grows into love, and together, they build a story about family, trust, and second chances.

entry.title: Evergrowing
entry.summary:
Author: starylighting

Rating: MatureLanguage: EnglishWords: 403,260Chapters: 59/?Kudos: 25

Summary: Athena and Bobby are learning that parenting doesn‚Äôt end when the kids turn eighteen. With three grown children and two still at home, Bobby and Athena find themselves navigating new challenges at every stage of life. Each child carries their own struggles, some spoken and some hidden, but together the family works through the ups and downs with love, patience, and resilience. At the heart of it all, they‚Äôre reminded that family is a bond that grows, shifts, and deepens, no matter how old the kids get.

entry.title: The Price of Power
entry.summary:
Author: starylighting

Rating: ExplicitLanguage: EnglishWords: 245,458Chapters: 42/?Kudos: 23

Summary: Athena Carter and Bobby Nash couldn‚Äôt be more different. She‚Äôs the disciplined ‚Äúgood girl‚Äù with her future mapped out, while he‚Äôs the dangerous bad boy with one foot in college and the other in the streets. When their worlds start to collide, what begins as a bitter rivalry quickly sparks into something deeper neither of them can ignore. But falling for Bobby means stepping into a world Athena never imagined, one ruled by loyalty and violence. That tested everything she thought she knew about herself. As sparks turn to fire, Athena must decide if love is worth the risk of losing everything.

entry.title: What a night to forget.
entry.summary:
Author: Absolute_Maniac

Rating: Not RatedLanguage: EnglishWords: 10,751Chapters: 7/?Kudos: 77

Summary: ‚ÄúHey, can you see my phone anywhere?‚Äù he asked. Eddie started looking around the bed and then stretched himself to his side of the bed and pulled it from the nightstand.‚ÄúHere.‚Äù He tossed it to him, and Buck immediately started looking through recent pictures on his phone. Pictures of them partying, a video of Eddie taking a shot, and another video of Eddie dancing.Then he came across the next picture and felt as if someone had thrown a bucket of ice water over his head. They must have asked someone else to take the picture because it was taken from at least a two-meter distance. The two of them were holding out a piece of paper towards the camera‚Ä¶ and they were pressed together in a passionate kiss.Buck looked up from the picture when Eddie made a strangled sound on the other side of the room. ‚ÄúYou might want to see this‚Ä¶‚Äù He reached over with a piece of paper in his hand. Buck took it and turned his phone over to him in return. Eddie bit into his fist as he studied the picture. Buck looked down at the paper in his hand and turned it over to the right side. It was a copy of a marriage license for Mr. Evan Buckley-Diaz and Mr. Edmundo Buckley-Diaz.

entry.title: My advice is always ruin the friendship (Better that than regret it for all time)
entry.summary:
Author: Buddie_Girl

Rating: MatureLanguage: EnglishWords: 2,706Chapters: 1/?Kudos: 32

Summary: He looked down, shocked to see Christopher‚Äôs number displayed across his screen. They had texted occasionally, but it had been over six years since they last saw each other, and since Christopher never called him, something was clearly wrong. ‚ÄúChris?‚Äù ‚ÄúHey Buck, I know it's been a while, and I‚Äôm sorry to be so blunt, but Dad was hurt in a fire six weeks ago and has been in a coma ever since.‚Äù The color drains from Buck‚Äôs face. ‚ÄúI begged them to let him fight, but they won‚Äôt listen. Grandma and Abuelo, they want to‚Ä¶‚Äù He doesn‚Äôt let Christopher finish, ‚ÄúChristopher, is your dad dead?‚Äù He braces himself for the answer. It may have been over six years, but deep down, Buck‚Äôs feelings for his former partner have never changed. ‚ÄúNo, because they aren‚Äôt in Dad‚Äôs power of attorney, you are.‚Äù Christopher tells him, ‚ÄúThey tried to hide his will, but when they suggested pulling the plug, the hospital contacted the fire station that Dad works at, just to verify, and his captain turned it over. They couldn‚Äôt remove life support because they need you to sign off. I need you too‚Ä¶‚Äù Buck doesn‚Äôt even hear the last part as he‚Äôs sucked into his own thoughts.

entry.title: one single glimpse of relief
entry.summary:
Author: greyspilot

Rating: ExplicitLanguage: EnglishWords: 39,012Chapters: 8/20Kudos: 109

Summary: "What if I never get better? What if I always feel like this?" Buck finally looks back up at him, vulnerability and compassion clear on his too-expressive face. "I don't know," he says honestly. "I don't‚Ä¶" he shudders, gives a tiny shrug of his shoulders and tries again. "I don't have an answer for that, man. It's been seven months for me and I still feel‚Ä¶like this." "Like what?" Buck just shrugs again, then mumbles, "Not myself." And Eddie doesn't know what to say to that either, because this is the only version of Buck he's ever known.Or: Buck and Eddie meet at grief group.

entry.title: Leaving and Growing Up
entry.summary:
Author: ratking_withnotail

Rating: MatureLanguage: EnglishWords: 168,845Chapters: 14/?Kudos: 862

Summary: Percy Jackson was excited‚Äîgenuinely excited‚Äîfor the first time in what felt like years. A new city. A new name. A new face, even. The golden hair, the pale blue eyes, the tattoos that traced his skin like constellations‚Äînone of it screamed ‚ÄúPercy Jackson‚Äù anymore. He was Evan Buckley now, or just Buck, depending on who asked. He‚Äôd keep busy‚Äîphysically exhausted, mentally occupied, emotionally detached. That was the key. No attachments. No friendships. No relationships. No vulnerability. He‚Äôd learned the hard way that getting close to people only ended in pain. Either they died, betrayed him, or saw the legend behind the name and stopped seeing him altogether. Unfortunately, he hadn‚Äôt planned on the 118.
